CHESPIN.description:
The quills on its head are usually soft.
When it flexes them, the points become
so hard and sharp that they can pierce
rock without any effort.

QUILLADIN.description:
They strengthen the sturdy shell covering
their bodies by running into one another.
They are very kind and won't start fights,
but will counterattack with sharp quills.

CHESNAUGHT.description:
It shields its allies from danger with
its own body. When it takes a defensive
posture with its fists guarding its face,
it can withstand a bomb blast.

MEGA.description: It has fortified armor and a\nwill to defend at all costs.\nBoth are absurdly strong.

FENNEKIN.description:
As it walks, it munches on a twig to fill
itself with energy in place of a snack.
It intimidates opponents by puffing hot
air out of its roomy ears.

BRAIXEN.description:
Braixen has a twig stuck in its tail.
When the twig is plucked from its tail,
friction sets the twig alight. The flame
is used to send signals to its allies.

DELPHOX.description:
It gazes into the flame at the tip of its
branch to achieve a focused state, which
allows it to see into the future. It uses
psychic power to incinerate its foes.

MEGA.description:
It wields flaming branches to
dazzle its opponents before
incinerating them with a
huge fireball.

FROAKIE.description:
It protects its skin by covering its body
in bubbles it secretes from its chest and
back. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it
keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

FROGADIER.description:
It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with
precise control, hitting empty cans up to
a hundred feet away. Frogadier's swiftness
is unparalleled.

MEGA.description:
This Pokémon spins a giant
shuriken at high speed to make it
float, then clings to it upside
down to catch opponents unawares.

BUNNELBY.description:
It has ears like shovels. Digging holes
strengthens its ears so much that they
can sever thick roots effortlessly.
Bunnelby dig the whole night through.

DIGGERSBY.description:
With its powerful ears it reduces dense
bedrock to rubble. It can be a big help
at construction sites. When it's finished
digging, it lounges about lazily.

FLETCHLING.description:
This amiable Pokémon is easy to train.
But when battle is joined, it shows its
ferocious side. It's merciless to
intruders that enter its territory.

FLETCHINDER.description:
From its beak, it expels embers that set
the tall grass on fire. Then it pounces on
any bewildered Pokémon that pop out of
the grass.

TALONFLAME.description:
In the fever of an exciting battle, it
showers embers from the gaps between its
feathers and takes to the air. It finishes
its prey off with a colossal kick.

VIVILLON_ICY_SNOW.description:
Its pattern depends on the climate and
topography of the land it was born in.
This form is from frigid lands.
It scatters toxic color scales in battle.

VIVILLON_POLAR.description:
Its pattern depends on the climate and
topography of the land it was born in.
This form is from snowy lands.
It scatters toxic color scales in battle.

VIVILLON_TUNDRA.description:
Its pattern depends on the climate and
topography of the land it was born in.
This form is from lands of severe cold.
It scatters toxic color scales in battle.

VIVILLON_CONTINENTAL.description:
Its pattern depends on the climate and
topography of the land it was born in.
This form is from lands of vast space.
It scatters toxic color scales in battle.

VIVILLON_GARDEN.description:
Its pattern depends on the climate and
topography of the land it was born in.
This form is from verdant lands.
It scatters toxic color scales in battle.

VIVILLON_ELEGANT.description:
Its pattern depends on the climate and
topography of the land it was born in. This
form is from lands with distinct seasons.
It scatters toxic color scales in battle.

VIVILLON_MEADOW.description:
Its pattern depends on the climate and
topography of the land it was born in. This
form is from lands where flowers bloom.
It scatters toxic color scales in battle.

VIVILLON_MODERN.description:
Its pattern depends on the climate and
topography of the land it was born in.
This form is from sun-drenched lands.
It scatters toxic color scales in battle.

VIVILLON_MARINE.description:
Its pattern depends on the climate and
topography of the land it was born in. This
form is from lands with ocean breezes.
It scatters toxic color scales in battle.

VIVILLON_ARCHIPELAGO.description:
Its pattern depends on the climate and
topography of the land it was born in.
This form is from places with many islands.
It scatters toxic color scales in battle.

VIVILLON_HIGH_PLAINS.description:
Its pattern depends on the climate and
topography of the land it was born in.
This form is from lands with little rain.
It scatters toxic color scales in battle.

VIVILLON_SANDSTORM.description:
Its pattern depends on the climate and
topography of the land it was born in.
This form is from parched lands.
It scatters toxic color scales in battle.

VIVILLON_RIVER.description:
Its pattern depends on the climate and
topography of the land it was born in. This
form is from lands where large rivers flow.
It scatters toxic color scales in battle.

VIVILLON_MONSOON.description:
Its pattern depends on the climate and
topography of the land it was born in. This
form is from lands with intense rainfall.
It scatters toxic color scales in battle.

VIVILLON_SAVANNA.description:
Its pattern depends on the climate and
topography of the land it was born in. This
form is from lands with a tropical climate.
It scatters toxic color scales in battle.

VIVILLON_SUN.description:
Its pattern depends on the climate and
topography of the land it was born in.
This form is from lands bathed in light.
It scatters toxic color scales in battle.

VIVILLON_OCEAN.description:
Its pattern depends on the climate and
topography of the land it was born in. This
form is from lands of perpetual summer.
It scatters toxic color scales in battle.

VIVILLON_JUNGLE.description:
Its pattern depends on the climate and
topography of the land it was born in. This
form is from lands of tropical rainforests.
It scatters toxic color scales in battle.

VIVILLON_FANCY.description:
Its pattern depends on the climate and
topography of the land it was born in.
This form is from a mysterious land.
It scatters toxic color scales in battle.

VIVILLON_POKEBALL.description:
Its pattern depends on the climate and
topography of the land it was born in.
This form is from a special land.
It scatters toxic color scales in battle.

LITLEO.description:
They set off on their own from their pride
and live by themselves to become stronger.
These hot-blooded Pokémon are quick
to start a fight.

PYROAR.description:
The male with the largest mane of fire
is the leader of the pride. The females
protect the pride's cubs. They viciously
threaten any challenger.

MEGA.description:
This Pokémon spews flames hotter
than 18,000 degrees Fahrenheit.
It swings around its grand, blazing
mane as it protects its allies.

FLABEBE_RED.description:
This Flabébé rides a red flower.
Immediately after birth, this Pokémon
begins flying around in search of a
flower it likes.

FLABEBE_YELLOW.description:
It unleashes a variety of moves by
drawing forth the power hidden
within flowers. This Pokémon is
particularly fond of yellow flowers.

FLABEBE_ORANGE.description:
It receives strength from flowers
and gives them some of its energy in
return. This Pokémon likes orange
flowers best of all.

FLABEBE_BLUE.description:
This Pokémon likes blue flowers
best of all. It floats upward using the
power emanating from its flower
and bobs along lightly through the air.

FLABEBE_WHITE.description:
When evening falls, it searches out
a place blooming with flowers of
the same white color as itself, and
then it goes to sleep.

FLOETTE_RED.description:
This Pokémon uses red wavelengths
of light to pour its own energy
into flowers and draw forth their
latent potential.

FLOETTE_YELLOW.description:
This Pokémon can draw forth the
power hidden within yellow flowers.
This power then becomes the moves
Floette uses to protect itself.

FLOETTE_ORANGE.description:
This Pokémon can draw forth the
most power when in sync with orange
flowers, compared to flowers of other
colors.

FLOETTE_BLUE.description:
Whenever this Pokémon finds
flowering plants that are withering, it
will bring them back to its territory
and care for them.

FLOETTE_WHITE.description:
If it finds someone messing up a
flower bed, it will attack them
without mercy. This Floette takes
particularly good care of white flowers.

FLOETTE_ETERNAL.description:
The flower it's holding can no
longer be found blooming anywhere. It's
also thought to contain terrifying
power.

FLORGES_RED.description:
This Pokémon creates an impressive
flower garden in its territory. It
draws forth the power of the red
flowers around its neck.

FLORGES_YELLOW.description:
This Pokémon battles by drawing
forth the power of yellow flowers. It
ruthlessly punishes anyone who
tramples on flowering plants.

FLORGES_ORANGE.description:
In times long past, castle
governors would lovingly raise Florges to
care for their castles' exquisite
gardens.

FLORGES_BLUE.description: Blue pigments were tremendously\nexpensive in the past, so paintings\nof blue Florges are highly valuable.

FLORGES_WHITE.description:
A flower garden made by a white-
flowered Florges will be beautifully
decorated with flowering plants of
many different colors.

SKIDDO.description:
If it has sunshine and water, it doesn't
need to eat, because it can generate
energy from the leaves on its back.
It has a placid disposition.

GOGOAT.description:
It can tell how its trainer is feeling by
subtle shifts in the grip on its horns. This
empathetic sense lets them run as if one
being. They inhabit mountainous regions.

PANCHAM.description:
There's no point to the leaf in its mouth,
aside from an effort to look cool. It's
mischievous, so it's not well suited to
inexperienced Trainers.

PANGORO.description:
It boasts superb physical strength.
Those who wish to become Pangoro's
Trainer have no choice but to converse
with their fists.

ESPURR.description:
It has enough psychic energy to blast
everything within 300 feet of itself.
The organ that emits its intense psychic
power is sheltered by its ears.

MEOWSTIC_F.description:
Females are a bit more selfish and
aggressive than males. If they
don't get what they want, they will
torment you with their psychic abilities.

MEOWSTIC_M.description:
The defensive instinct of the
males is strong. It's when they're
protecting themselves or their partners
that they unleash their full power.

HONEDGE.description:
If anyone dares to grab its hilt, it
wraps a blue cloth around that person's
arm and drains that person's life
energy completely.

DOUBLADE.description:
When Honedge evolves, it divides into
two swords. The complex attack patterns
of its two swords are unstoppable, even
against those skilled at swordplay.

AEGISLASH_BLADE.description:
Once upon a time, a king with an
Aegislash reigned over the land. His
Pokémon eventually drained him of
life, and his kingdom fell with him.

AEGISLASH_SHIELD.description:
In this defensive stance,
Aegislash uses its steel body and a force
field of spectral power to reduce the
damage of any attack.

SPRITZEE.description:
In the past, rather than using perfume,
royal ladies carried a Spritzee that would
waft a fragrance they liked. Its fragrance
changes depending on what it has eaten.

AROMATISSE.description:
Its scent is so overpowering that,
unless a Trainer happens to really enjoy
the smell, he or she will have a hard time
walking alongside it.

SWIRLIX.description:
Because it eats nothing but sweets, its
fur is as sticky sweet as cotton candy.
To entangle its opponents in battle, it
extrudes sticky white threads.

SLURPUFF.description:
Slurpuff can distinguish even the
faintest of scents. It puts its sensitive
sense of smell to use by helping pastry
chefs in their work.

INKAY.description:
It flashes the light-emitting spots on its
body, which drains its opponent's will
to fight. It takes the opportunity to
scuttle away and hide.

MALAMAR.description:
It lures prey close with hypnotic motions,
then wraps its tentacles around it before
finishing it off with digestive fluids. It
forces others to do whatever it wants.

MEGA.description:
It uses its colorful lights to
overwrite the personality and
memories of others-and to
control them.

BINACLE.description:
They stretch and then contract, yanking
their rocks along with them in bold hops.
They eat seaweed that washes up on
the shoreline.

BARBARACLE.description:
Barbaracle's legs and hands have minds
of their own, and they will move
independently. But they usually follow
the head's orders.

MEGA.description: It uses its many arms to toy\nwith its opponents. This\nkeeps the head extremely busy.

SKRELP.description:
Camouflaged as rotten kelp, it hides
from foes while storing up power for its
evolution. They spray liquid poison on
prey that approach unawares.

DRAGALGE.description:
Their poison is strong enough to eat
through the hull of a tanker. Tales are
told of ships that wander into seas where
Dragalge live, never to return.

MEGA.description:
It spits a liquid that causes the
regenerative power of cells to run
wild. The liquid is deadly poison
to everything other than itself.

CLAUNCHER.description:
Through controlled expulsions of internal
gas, it can expel water like a pistol shot.
At close distances, it can even shatter
large rocks.

CLAWITZER.description:
By expelling water from the nozzle in the
back of its enormous claw, it can move
at a speed of 60 knots. They launch
cannonballs made of water.

HELIOPTILE.description:
They make their home in deserts.
They can generate their own energy from
basking in the sun, so eating food is not
a requirement.

HELIOLISK.description:
A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient
electricity to power a skyscraper. It can
stimulate its muscles with electricity,
boosting the strength in its legs.

TYRUNT.description:
Its immense jaws have enough destructive
force that it can chew up a car. If
something happens that it doesn't like,
it throws a tantrum and runs wild.

TYRANTRUM.description:
Thanks to its gargantuan jaws, which could
shred thick metal plates as if they were
paper, it was invincible in the ancient
world it once inhabited.

AMAURA.description:
This ancient Pokémon was restored from
part of its body that had been frozen in
ice for over 100 million years. It lived in a
cold land where there were no predators.

AURORUS.description:
Using the diamond-shaped crystals on its
body it can instantly create a wall of ice
to block an opponent's attack, or encase
them in ice.

HAWLUCHA.description:
With its wings, it controls its position in
the air. Its proficient fighting skills
enable it to keep up with big bruisers
like Machamp and Hariyama.

MEGA.description: Mega Evolution has pumped up all\nits muscles. Hawlucha flexes to\nshow off its strength.

DEDENNE.description:
Its whiskers serve as antennas.
By sending and receiving electrical
waves, it can communicate with others
over vast distances.

CARBINK.description:
Born from the high temperatures and
pressures deep underground, it defends
itself by firing beams from the jewel part
of its body.

GOOMY.description:
Its source of protection is its slimy,
germ-laden mucous membrane. Anyone
who touches it will need some thorough
hand-washing.

SLIGGOO.description:
This Pokémon's mucous can dissolve
anything. Toothless, it sprays mucous
on its prey. Once they're nicely dissolved,
it slurps them up.

HISUI.description:
A creature given to melancholy.
Its metallic shell developed as a
result of the mucus on its skin reacting
with the iron in Hisui's water.

GOODRA.description:
It gets picked on because it's meek.
But then, whoever teased it gets to feel
the full force of its horns and a good
swatting from its thick tail.

HISUI.description:
It loathes solitude and is extremely
clingy--it will fume and run riot if
those dearest to it ever leave its
side.

KLEFKI.description:
These key collectors threaten any
attackers by fiercely jingling their keys
at them. It will sneak into people's homes
to steal their keys.

PHANTUMP.description:
According to legend, medicine to cure
any illness can be made by plucking the
green leaves on its head, brewing them,
and boiling down the liquid.

TREVENANT.description:
Through its roots, it exerts control over
other trees. A deadly curse falls upon
anyone cutting down trees in forests
where Trevenant dwell.

PUMPKABOO_LARGE.description: When taking spirits to the\nafterlife, large Pumpkaboo prefer the\nspirits of adults to those of children.

PUMPKABOO_AVERAGE.description:
The light that streams out from
the holes in the pumpkin can
hypnotize and control the people and
Pokémon that see it.

PUMPKABOO_SMALL.description: When taking spirits to the\nafterlife, small Pumpkaboo prefer the\nspirits of children to those of adults.

PUMPKABOO_SUPER.description: Supersized Pumpkaboo are very\npartial to the spirits of people who\nwere of similarly superior proportions.

GOURGEIST_LARGE.description:
A large-sized Pumpkaboo evolves
into a large-sized Gourgeist. Its
bodily proportions also get passed on
to its descendants.

GOURGEIST_AVERAGE.description:
Eerie cries emanate from its body
in the dead of night. The sounds are
said to be the wails of spirits who
are suffering in the afterlife.

GOURGEIST_SMALL.description:
A small-sized Pumpkaboo evolves
into a small-sized Gourgeist. Its
bodily proportions also get passed on
to its descendants.

GOURGEIST_SUPER.description:
A supersized Pumpkaboo evolves
into a supersized Gourgeist. Its
bodily proportions also get passed on to
its descendants.

BERGMITE.description:
It blocks opponents' attacks with the ice
that shields its body. It uses cold air to
repair any cracks with new ice. They live
in herds on snowy mountains.

AVALUGG.description:
The way several Bergmite huddle on its
back make it look like an aircraft carrier
made of ice. Its cumbersome frame crushes
anything that stands in its way.

HISUI.description: The armor of ice covering its lower\njaw puts steel to shame and can\nshatter rocks with ease.

NOIBAT.description:
They live in pitch-black caves. Even a
robust wrestler will become dizzy and
unable to stand when exposed to its
200,000-hertz ultrasonic waves.

NOIVERN.description:
They fly around on moonless nights and
attack careless prey. The ultrasonic
waves it emits from its ears can reduce
a large boulder to pebbles.

YVELTAL.description:
When its life comes to an end, its wings
and tail spread wide and glow red, and
it absorbs the life energy of every living
thing and turns into a cocoon.

ZYGARDE_COMPLETE.description:
This is Zygarde's perfected form.
From the orifice on its chest, it
radiates high-powered energy that
eliminates everything.

ZYGARDE_MEGA.description:
In response to people's emotions
during an unprecedented crisis,
Zygarde Mega Evolves and calms the
situation with its unmatched power.

DIANCIE.description:
A sudden transformation of Carbink,
its pink, glimmering body is said to be
the loveliest sight in the whole world.
It creates diamonds between its hands.

MEGA.description:
The impurities upon its body's surface
have fallen away, sparkling so brilliantly
that cannot be observed directly.
It is known as “the Royal Pink Princess”.

HOOPA_UNBOUND.description:
It is the true form of Hoopa, which has had
its power sealed away. The rings it carries
have the power to bend dimensions and are
able to seize anything in the world.

HOOPA_CONFINED.description:
In its true form, it possess a huge amount
of power. When its powers are sealed away,
it is transformed into a much smaller form.
It teleports things to a secret place.

VOLCANION.description:
It lets out billows of steam from the arms
on its back and disappears into the dense
fog. It's said to live in mountains where
humans do not tread.
